required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cesarean Rate in Parturients Without Neuraxial Analgesia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Cesarean Rate Between Parturients Who Received Neuraxial Analgesia and Those Who Did Not

brief_summary.textblock: Currently, it is certain that neuraxial analgesia in early stage of labor and delivery dose not increase the risk of Cesarean section. However, given ethical reasons, whether such a medical procedure could increase the Cesarean rate compared with those who did not received neuraxial analgesia or not is yet to be known. It is difficult to perform such a study in occidental countries because they have a higher rate of labor analgesia. On the contrary, the rate of labor analgesia in China is up to date only 1%, so it can be done easily. The investigators hypothesized that no neuraxial analgesia itself were a risk factor to Cesarean section. Therefore, the investigators design this study to compared the effect of neuraxial analgesia on the rate of Cesarean delivery with those who did not received neuraxial analgesia.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of Cesarean delivery in both neuraxial and non-neuraxial analgesia women

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of instrument-assisted delivery in both neuraxial and non-neuraxial analgesia women

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the begining of labor (0 min)
secondary_outcome.description: Labor pain intensity assessed using visual analog scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the cervix 10 cm (This time may be subjected to change in different patients)
secondary_outcome.description: Labor pain intensity assessed using visual analog scale (VAS)
Labor pain intensity assessed using visual analog scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial of labor (0 min) to completion of delivery (this is changable individually)
secondary_outcome.description: Labor duration in both neuraxial and non-neuraxial analgesia women

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of the first stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial of the labor to the cervix reached to 10 cm (Different in different patients)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of the first stage of labor

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of second stage of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the cervix at 10 cm to successful delivery of the baby (this is changable individually)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of the second stage of labor

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall feeling of satisfaction of the labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of successful baby delivery (it is changable individually)
secondary_outcome.description: Satisfaction assessed using a visual analog scale (VAS) at the end of the labor delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial of labor (0 min) to the end of the labor (is is changable individually)
secondary_outcome.description: Side effects recorded from the labor initiation to successful delivery

arm_group.description: Parturients will not receive neuraxial analgesia

intervention.description: Neuraxial analgesia will be given at any time if the parturient requested analgesia
No neuraxial analgesia will be given to those who will not want to an analgesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >= 19yr, <=40 yr
- Height 140 - 170 cm
- Singleton pregnancy
- Uncomplicated pregnancy
- Chinese
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple gestations
- Pregnancy-induced hypertension
- Diabetes mellitus
- Chronic pain
- Allergic to opioids and/or local anesthetics
- Failed to performing inter lumbar space catheterization
- Organic dysfunction
- Contraindications for neuraxial analgesia

facility.name: Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital
